page.title: 12Yealmpton Cider Press
page.content: In recent years{the old cider press}at Bowden Farm was restored by the Amenity Society and cider was once more produced. Bowden Farm is now being redeveloped to provide housing , using as much as possible of the old farm buildings. The developer has offered the cider press to the village with the proviso that a permenant home will be found for it in the village. It is hoped that it will eventually be placed at the new community centre. On a Monday in June the press was detatched from it's base and lifted on to a transporter and removed to temporary accomodation at the farm of Mr.Cross. {New England Quarry.}Quarry extracts a volcanic rock called dolerite.This quarry was started in 1930 and at present employs 15 men and processes approx 150,000 tonnes per year.
